results.title: Yevtushenko: a poet's journey
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities
results.brief_description: On a tour of the US and at home in his Moscow appartment, Russian poet Yevgeny Yevtushenko struggles with the responsibilities traditionally contigent on his country’s writers; custodians of the public conscience and witnesses to the naked tragedy of life in a hostile physical environement and under a succession of autocratic regimes. Yevtushenko is both the gentle melancholy writer and the powerful and charismatic poet-performer; the film captures this duality in his impassioned readings of the poems ‘Babi Yar’, ‘Prologue’ and ‘Bratski Station’. A hauntingly beautiful portrait of this fine Russian poet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities

results.title: E E Cummings: the making of a poet
results.brief_description: Traces the poetic growth of E. E. Cummings, using his own voice, poetry paintings, drwaings and notebooks. Poems included are: ‘Thank You God For Most This Amazing’, ‘If There Are Any Heavens My Mother’, ‘In Just Spring’, ‘Life Is More True Than Reason Will Deceive’, ‘Paris’, “The April Sunset Completely Utters’, ‘Carry Your Heart With Me’ and others. The narration is adapted from ‘Six Nonlectures’ by E. E. Cummings recorded at Havard University.

results.title: Sophocles: Oedipus the King
results.brief_description: An Abridged version of Sophocles’ play performed in the 5th century BC amphitheatre at Amphiaralon by the Athens Classical Theatre Company styled on the ancient models. Narrated by Anthony Quayle, it features James Mason as Oedipus, Claire Bloom as Jocasta and Ian Richardson as Tiresias.

results.title: The Legend of Mark Twain
results.creator_credit: Karl Genus, Daniel Wilson, Benchmark Films and Jules Power Productions
results.brief_description: Follows Samuel Clemens’ life and career on the American literary scene and dramatises selections from two of his well-known classics - “The Celebrated jumping frog of Calaveras County” and “The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn”. Cast includes David Wayne.

results.title: One
results.creator_credit: Robert Just, Mark Tarnawsky and Little Red Filmhouse
results.brief_description: Non-narrated film in which a young boy waiting for his father in an office complex becomes bored. He wanders off around the city and discovers a mime artist performing in the street.

results.title: Weekend magazine: kite flying festival
results.brief_description: The 1983 Singapore International Kite Festival provided a venue for kite enthusiasts from all over the world. This film features some of the entries, including traditional eastern kites and more innovative designs such as the world’s largest kite which required a huge army truck as an anchor. Also takes a brief historical look at the kite and people’s fascination with it.

results.title: Stress management: wedding daze
results.creator_credit: A. Scott Miller, Robert Boucher and Paramount Communications
results.brief_description: Follows the members of a wedding party on the day of the wedding and shows their various reactions to the stresses under which they are placed. Points out that negative reactions to stress can be avoided and suggests how to accomplish this. Suitable for upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: On the road with Circus Oz
results.creator_credit: Zbigniew Friedrich, Don McLennan and Ukiyo Films
results.brief_description: Follows the members of Circus Oz on a six week country tour. Performances and rehearsals are juxtaposed with interviews and scenes of the back-breaking effort that goes into keeping the show on the road. Reveals the performers as being dedicated to their skills, and commited to a philosophy which precludes any hierarchical structure or discrimination on the grounds of sex or ability. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: How does a computer work?
results.brief_description: An animated guide through the complexities of the central processor function of the computer, showing how it controls the input and output of information, how it calculates and how it makes logical decisions. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Strongest man in the world
results.brief_description: Combines archival film, stills and live footage to present a compelling portrait of Mike Swistun, a seventy-eight year old Canadian farmer of Ukrainian origin, who at one time was billed the ‘strongest man in the world’ by Ringling Brothers’ Barnum and Bailey Circus. Touches on aspects of social change; people’s attitudes to popular entertainment; the changing role of circuses; and the position of old men in modern society. Narrated ny Jack Palance.
